According to my research, the Samurai adhered to seven base virtues: GI (Ri=
ght Action, Duty), YUUKI (Courage), JIN (Benevolence), REI (Politeness/Mora=
lity), MAKOTO (Truthfulness), MEIYO (Honor), CHUUGI (Loyalty)

I know when =
things are translated from one language to another, things get lost in tran=
slation. Meaning and context, for one, so I know I don't grasp the whole un=
derstanding of the virtues.

As to Zen and Shinto... I'm not sure Zen is a =
religion, but the Art of Zen seems like it was widely practiced.... Zen is =
"at right with the universe", I think. Shinto was practiced by pretty much =
everybody not practicing Buddhism, but I couldn't say who practiced it win.=
 Between Shinto and Buddhism, all I know is that modern-day Japanese pretty=
 much do both, so the two couldn't have been class/sect-exclusive...

My lo=
gic might be wrong though.

Still looking for the Sins. Anybody else found =
any?
